get.description:
Configure local management settings of network devices via SSH, Telnet, console, or UI.
This ensures secure, controlled, and monitored access to the devices. Manage AAA
(Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting) for device local management, and it ensures
that only authorized users can access the device, perform specific actions, and that all
activities are logged for auditing purposes. This feature is applicable for all devices.

post.summary: Create a new Local Management Profile by name.
post.description:
List of Local Management Profiles.
For CX device, only 1 profile supported.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Local Management Profile name to be configured.

get.summary: Read existing Local Management Profile by name.
get.description:
List of Local Management Profiles.
For CX device, only 1 profile supported.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Local Management Profile name to be configured.

patch.summary: Update existing Local Management Profile by name.
patch.description:
List of Local Management Profiles.
For CX device, only 1 profile supported.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Local Management Profile name to be configured.

delete.summary: Delete a Local Management Profile by name.
delete.description:
List of Local Management Profiles.
For CX device, only 1 profile supported.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Local Management Profile name to be configured.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaLocalManagement_LocalManagementSche.description:
Configure local management settings of network devices via SSH, Telnet, console, or UI.
This ensures secure, controlled, and monitored access to the devices. Manage AAA
(Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting) for device local management, and it ensures
that only authorized users can access the device, perform specific actions, and that all
activities are logged for auditing purposes. This feature is applicable for all devices.

profile.description:
List of Local Management Profiles.
For CX device, only 1 profile supported.

name.description: Local Management Profile name to be configured.

enable.description: Enables console access through the serial port.

baud-rate.description: Console serial port data transmission speed.

x-enumDescriptions.XON_XOFF: XON or XOFF used as serial port flow control method.
x-enumDescriptions.NONE: No serial port flow control method used.

flow-control.x-typeDescription: Console serial port flow control method.
flow-control.description: Console serial port flow control method.

usb-idle-timeout.description: Serial or USB console session timeout.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Raw mode with no terminal escape sequences.

local-terminal.x-typeDescription: Enables type of terminal for the current console.
local-terminal.description: Enable the type of terminal for the current console sessions.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Raw mode with no terminal escape sequences.

terminal.x-typeDescription: Enables type of terminal for the current console.
terminal.description: Enable the type of terminal for the all console sessions.

max-sessions.description: Maximum concurrent sessions supported by the device.

serviceos-password-prompt.description: Enables the ServiceOS boot loader password prompt.

screen-refresh.description: Configure the refresh time in seconds for menu status and counters.

x-enumDescriptions.NOT_INFO: Only Critical, Warn, and Debug level log events.

events.description: Set level of the events displayed in the device's Events Log.

audit-period.description: Configure audit period. Value of 0 implies disabling of audit-info.

localauth.description: Enable Local authentication even if radius authentication times out.

bluetooth.description: Enables management access to a switch through a USB Bluetooth adapter.

hash-mgmt-password.description: Enable/Disable hashing of the management user password.

enable.description: Enable hashing of the management user password.

min-password-length.description:
Minimum password length.
If this value exceeds the current password length, the user will be prompted to change their password at the next login.

managed-mode-profile.description: Enable automatic configuration of the APs in the management mode.

server-name.description:
Name of the server or the IP address of the server from which the
configuration file must be downloaded.

automatic.description:
Enables the automatic mode to automatically generate the user
credentials based on AP MAC address.

username.description: Username credentials set by user to enable automatic configuration when automatic is false.

password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
password.description: Password credentials set by the user to enable automatic configuration when automatic is false.

x-enumDescriptions.FTP: FTP used for downloading configuration files.
x-enumDescriptions.FTPS: FTPS used for downloading configuration files.

retry-poll-period.description:
Time interval in minutes between two retries, after which
APs can retry downloading the configuration file.

sync-day.description:
Configuration day, for example to configure Sunday as day, specify 01.
To configure the synchronization period as everyday, enter 00.

sync-hour.description: Configuration hour in the range of 0-23.

sync-minute.description: Configuration minute in the range of 0-59.

sync-window.description:
Defines a window for synchronization of the configuration file.
The default value is 3 hours.

user-lockout.description: User lockout configuration for management interfaces.

x-enumDescriptions.LOGIN:
Remote CLI login for SSH and Telnet.
For a CX device, this includes remote REST login also.

session.description: User sessions for which the lockout is applied

denylist-period.description:
Time period for which the unauthorizes users will be denylisted.
The value is measured in seconds.
For a CX device, the range is 1..3600 seconds. This value has no effect unless threshold is set.
For AP, valid range is 10..65535.

threshold.description:
Number of invalid login attempts before a user is blocked out of the system.
For a CX device, the range is 1..10.
If no value is set, the default is no limit on login attempts.

num-attempts.description:
Number of invalid login attempts before a user is blocked out of the system.
For PVOS device, valid values range from 1 to 10.
If no value is set, the default is no limit on login attempts.

lockout-delay.description:
Time period for which the unauthorizes users will be denylisted.
The value is measured in seconds.
For PVOS, valid range is 0..3600 seconds.

minimum-length.description:
Minimum password length required.
For a Gateway device, the default value is 6 characters and the range of values is 6-128 characters.
For a CX device, the default minimum length of the password is 8 characters.
For a CX device, the range is 1..32 for firmware versions 10.12 and earlier, 1..64 otherwise.
For PVOS device, valid values range from 0 to 64.

password-aging-period.description: Password aging period for a system.

password-alert-before-expiry.description: Number of days before password aging during which user is warned of pending password expiry.

password-expired-user-login-attempts.description: Number of subsequent logins allowed after password expiry.

password-expiry-user-login-attempts-peri.description: Duration in days in which the particular logins are allowed.

password-update-interval.description: Wait duration in hours before the password update.

history-count.description:
Maximum number of password history count for each user.
For a CX device, the default password history count is 5 and the range is 1-5.
For a PVOS device, the default password history count is 8, with a valid range of 2 to 15.

repeat-char-check.description: Password repeat character check ensures password does not contain three of the same characters used consecutively.

repeat-password-check.description: Password repeat check ensures same password is not allowed.

repeat-username-check.description: Password repeat username check ensures same username or reverse of username is not set as password.

all-repeat-check.description: Enables all possible repeat checks avialable.

min-char-difference.description:
Minimum number of character that the new password differes from old password.
For a CX device, the default value is 8 characters.
For a CX device, the range is 1..32 for firmware versions 10.12 and earlier, 1..64 otherwise.
For PVOS device, valid values range from 8 to 64.

numeric-count.description:
Minimum number of numeric count in a password.
For a Gateway device, the range of values is 0-10 numeric digits and the default value is 0.
For a CX device, the default value is 1 character.
For a CX device, the range is 0..32 for firmware versions 10.12 and earlier.
For PVOS device, valid values range from 2 to 15 numeric digits, with a default of 2.

lowercase-count.description:
Minimum number of lowercase count in a password.
For a Gateway device, the range of values is  0-10 minimum lower case characters. A value of 0 indicates that the minimum number of lower case required is disabled by default.
For a CX device, the default value is 1 character.
For a CX device, the range is 0..32 for firmware versions 10.12 and earlier.
For PVOS device, valid values range from 2 to 15 lowercase characters, with a default of 2.

uppercase-count.description:
Minimum number of uppercase count in a password.
For a Gateway device, the range of values is 0-10 minimum upper case characters. A value of 0 indicates that minimum number of upper case required is disabled by default.
For a CX device, the default value is 1 character.
For a CX device, the range is 0..32 for firmware versions 10.12 and earlier.
For PVOS device, valid values range from 2 to 15 uppercase characters, with a default of 2.

special-char-count.description:
Minimum number of special character count in a password.
For a Gateway device, the special characters are !, @, #, $, %, ^, &, *, <, >, {, }, [, ], :, ., comma, |, +, ~, `. The range of values is 0-10 special characters. A value of 0 indicates that the minimum number of special character required is disabled by default. The following ( ')', '(' ;, -, space, =, /, ?) are dis-allowed.
For a CX device, the default value is 1 character.
For a CX device, the range is 0..32 for firmware versions 10.12 and earlier.
For PVOS device, valid values range from 2 to 15 special characters, with a default of 2.

adjacent-char-type-count.description:
Maximum number of adjacent characters allowed from character set.
For a Gateway device, the range of values is 0-10 max consecutive characters. A value of 0 indicates that enforcing of maximum number of consecutive character repeat is disabled by default.
For a CX device, the default value is 0 character. A value of 0 indicates that the enforcement on the adjacent characters from the character set in the password is disabled by default.

certificate-lock-out.description: Configuring the number of failed attempts within 3 minute window to lockout the user. Provides ability to reduce the number of login attempts that can be made in a short time. Automatically clears the lockout after configured 'lock-out' minutes. A value of 0 indicates that lockout of users is disabled.

certificate-lock-out-time.description: Configuring the number of minutes the user is locked out. The lockout is cleared without administrator intervention.

password-lock-out.description: Configuring the number of failed attempts within 3 minute window to lockout the user. Provides ability to reduce the number of passwords that can be guessed in a short time. Automatically clears the lockout after configured 'lock-out' minutes. A value of 0 indicates that lockout of users is disabled.

password-lock-out-time.description: Configuring the number of minutes the user is locked out. The lockout is cleared without administrator intervention.

telnet-server.description: Enables Telnet access to the CLI

enable.description: Enable Telnet access to the system.

telnet-server-listen-interface.description: The type of interface that the telnet server is available.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
items.description: VRF on which the telnet server is enabled/disabled.

enable.description: Enable Telnet access to the system.

tftp-listen-interface.description: The type of interface that the TFTP server is available.

enable.description: Enable Telnet access to the system.

x-enumDescriptions.AES_CBC: Disable AES-CBC authentication. AES-CTR will be enabled.
x-enumDescriptions.AES_CTR: Disable AES-CTR authentication. AES-CBC will be enabled.

items.description:
Disable specific cipher authentication for SSH.
Range: AES_CBC, AES_CTR.
Disable specific MAC authentication for SSH.

disable-kex.description: Disable key exchange (KEX) algorithm for SSH.

disable-dsa.description: Disable DSA for SSH and only allow RSA.

mgmt-auth-public-key.description: Management user's SSH Authentication method by public-key auth.

mgmt-auth-uname-pwd.description: Management user's SSH Authentication method by username & password.

login-session-timeout.description:
If there is no activity for this duration the Management(Telnet, SSH and Console) session is terminated.
For a CX device, the default value is 30 minutes. A value of 0 disables the timeout.
For AP, valid range is 0 and 5-60 minitues, 0 to disable.
For GW value of '0' disables it. default 15 minutes. Range is <1-60> minutes

tracking-range.description:
The maximum time period, in days, for which a user's login sessions will be tracked.
For a CX device, the default value is 30 days and the range allowed is 1..30 days.

max-sessions-per-user.description:
Maximum concurrent sessions per user.
For a CX device, the range allowed is 1-5 sessions.

banner-message.description: Banner to be displayed at the login prompt when a user connects to the management interface.

enforce-accept.description: WebUI users must accept the banner to login.

text.description: For PVOS devices, the authentication banner-message text length ranges from 1 to 3055 characters for firmware versions 16.11.0021 and earlier, and from 1 to 3068 characters for firmware versions 16.11.0022 and later.

banner-exec.description:
Banner to be displayed after a successful login with the management
interface.

text.description: For PVOS devices, the authentication banner-exec text length ranges from 1 to 3055 characters for firmware versions 16.11.0021 and earlier, and from 1 to 3068 characters for firmware versions 16.11.0022 and later.

cli-authorization.description: Configure NAE agent ActionCLI commands to require authorization.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

name.description: Local Management Profile name to be configured.

enable.description: Enables console access through the serial port.

baud-rate.description: Console serial port data transmission speed.

x-enumDescriptions.XON_XOFF: XON or XOFF used as serial port flow control method.
x-enumDescriptions.NONE: No serial port flow control method used.

flow-control.x-typeDescription: Console serial port flow control method.
flow-control.description: Console serial port flow control method.

usb-idle-timeout.description: Serial or USB console session timeout.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Raw mode with no terminal escape sequences.

local-terminal.x-typeDescription: Enables type of terminal for the current console.
local-terminal.description: Enable the type of terminal for the current console sessions.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Raw mode with no terminal escape sequences.

terminal.x-typeDescription: Enables type of terminal for the current console.
terminal.description: Enable the type of terminal for the all console sessions.

max-sessions.description: Maximum concurrent sessions supported by the device.

screen-refresh.description: Configure the refresh time in seconds for menu status and counters.

events.description: Set level of the events displayed in the device's Events Log.

audit-period.description: Configure audit period. Value of 0 implies disabling of audit-info.

localauth.description: Enable Local authentication even if radius authentication times out.

bluetooth.description: Enables management access to a switch through a USB Bluetooth adapter.

enable.description: Enable hashing of the management user password.

Minimum password length.
If this value exceeds the current password length, the user will be prompted to change their password at the next login.

configuration file must be downloaded.

A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store

password.description: Password credentials set by the user to enable automatic configuration when automatic is false.

x-enumDescriptions.FTP: FTP used for downloading configuration files.
x-enumDescriptions.FTPS: FTPS used for downloading configuration files.

retry-poll-period.description:
Time interval in minutes between two retries, after which
APs can retry downloading the configuration file.

sync-day.description:
Configuration day, for example to configure Sunday as day, specify 01.
To configure the synchronization period as everyday, enter 00.

sync-hour.description: Configuration hour in the range of 0-23.

sync-minute.description: Configuration minute in the range of 0-59.

sync-window.description:
Defines a window for synchronization of the configuration file.
The default value is 3 hours.

user-lockout.description: User lockout configuration for management interfaces.

Remote CLI login for SSH and Telnet.
For a CX device, this includes remote REST login also.

session.description: User sessions for which the lockout is applied

denylist-period.description:
Time period for which the unauthorizes users will be denylisted.
The value is measured in seconds.
For a CX device, the range is 1..3600 seconds. This value has no effect unless threshold is set.
For AP, valid range is 10..65535.

threshold.description:
Number of invalid login attempts before a user is blocked out of the system.
For a CX device, the range is 1..10.
If no value is set, the default is no limit on login attempts.

num-attempts.description:
Number of invalid login attempts before a user is blocked out of the system.
For PVOS device, valid values range from 1 to 10.
If no value is set, the default is no limit on login attempts.

lockout-delay.description:
Time period for which the unauthorizes users will be denylisted.
The value is measured in seconds.

minimum-length.description:
Minimum password length required.
For a Gateway device, the default value is 6 characters and the range of values is 6-128 characters.

password-aging-period.description: Password aging period for a system.

password-alert-before-expiry.description: Number of days before password aging during which user is warned of pending password expiry.

password-expired-user-login-attempts.description: Number of subsequent logins allowed after password expiry.

password-expiry-user-login-attempts-peri.description: Duration in days in which the particular logins are allowed.

Maximum number of password history count for each user.
For a CX device, the default password history count is 5 and the range is 1-5.
For a PVOS device, the default password history count is 8, with a valid range of 2 to 15.

repeat-char-check.description: Password repeat character check ensures password does not contain three of the same characters used consecutively.

repeat-username-check.description: Password repeat username check ensures same username or reverse of username is not set as password.

min-char-difference.description:

For a CX device, the default value is 8 characters.
For a CX device, the range is 1..32 for firmware versions 10.12 and earlier, 1..64 otherwise.

For a Gateway device, the range of values is 0-10 numeric digits and the default value is 0.
For a CX device, the default value is 1 character.

For a Gateway device, the range of values is 0-10 minimum upper case characters. A value of 0 indicates that minimum number of upper case required is disabled by default.
For a CX device, the default value is 1 character.
For a CX device, the range is 0..32 for firmware versions 10.12 and earlier.
For PVOS device, valid values range from 2 to 15 uppercase characters, with a default of 2.

For a CX device, the default value is 1 character.
For a CX device, the range is 0..32 for firmware versions 10.12 and earlier.
For PVOS device, valid values range from 2 to 15 special characters, with a default of 2.

Maximum number of adjacent characters allowed from character set.
For a Gateway device, the range of values is 0-10 max consecutive characters. A value of 0 indicates that enforcing of maximum number of consecutive character repeat is disabled by default.
For a CX device, the default value is 0 character. A value of 0 indicates that the enforcement on the adjacent characters from the character set in the password is disabled by default.

Provides ability to reduce the number of login attempts that can be made in a short time. Automatically clears the lockout after configured 'lock-out' minutes. A value of 0 indicates that lockout of users is disabled.

certificate-lock-out-time.description: Configuring the number of minutes the user is locked out. The lockout is cleared without administrator intervention.

password-lock-out.description: Configuring the number of failed attempts within 3 minute window to lockout the user. Provides ability to reduce the number of passwords that can be guessed in a short time. Automatically clears the lockout after configured 'lock-out' minutes. A value of 0 indicates that lockout of users is disabled.

password-lock-out-time.description: Configuring the number of minutes the user is locked out. The lockout is cleared without administrator intervention.

telnet-server.description: Enables Telnet access to the CLI

enable.description: Enable Telnet access to the system.

telnet-server-listen-interface.description: The type of interface that the telnet server is available.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
items.description: VRF on which the telnet server is enabled/disabled.

enable.description: Enable Telnet access to the system.

tftp-listen-interface.description: The type of interface that the TFTP server is available.

enable.description: Enable Telnet access to the system.

x-enumDescriptions.AES_CBC: Disable AES-CBC authentication. AES-CTR will be enabled.
x-enumDescriptions.AES_CTR: Disable AES-CTR authentication. AES-CBC will be enabled.

items.description:
Disable specific cipher authentication for SSH.
Range: AES_CBC, AES_CTR.
Disable specific MAC authentication for SSH.

disable-kex.description: Disable key exchange (KEX) algorithm for SSH.

disable-dsa.description: Disable DSA for SSH and only allow RSA.

mgmt-auth-public-key.description: Management user's SSH Authentication method by public-key auth.

mgmt-auth-uname-pwd.description: Management user's SSH Authentication method by username & password.

login-session-timeout.description:
If there is no activity for this duration the Management(Telnet, SSH and Console) session is terminated.
For a CX device, the default value is 30 minutes. A value of 0 disables the timeout.
For AP, valid range is 0 and 5-60 minitues, 0 to disable.
For GW value of '0' disables it. default 15 minutes. Range is <1-60> minutes

tracking-range.description:
The maximum time period, in days, for which a user's login sessions will be tracked.
For a CX device, the default value is 30 days and the range allowed is 1..30 days.

max-sessions-per-user.description:
Maximum concurrent sessions per user.
For a CX device, the range allowed is 1-5 sessions.

banner-message.description: Banner to be displayed at the login prompt when a user connects to the management interface.

enforce-accept.description: WebUI users must accept the banner to login.

text.description: For PVOS devices, the authentication banner-message text length ranges from 1 to 3055 characters for firmware versions 16.11.0021 and earlier, and from 1 to 3068 characters for firmware versions 16.11.0022 and later.

banner-exec.description:
Banner to be displayed after a successful login with the management
interface.

text.description: For PVOS devices, the authentication banner-exec text length ranges from 1 to 3055 characters for firmware versions 16.11.0021 and earlier, and from 1 to 3068 characters for firmware versions 16.11.0022 and later.

cli-authorization.description: Configure NAE agent ActionCLI commands to require authorization.

authentication-group.description: Specifies the list of server groups and the order in which they will be applied for authentication of management sessions.

x-enumDescriptions.HTTPS_SERVER: https-server Session consists of both Web UI and REST

x-enumDescriptions.ENABLE: Login of session for manager mode
x-enumDescriptions.CLIENT: Login of session for client mode

auth-instances.description:
Server group configuration.
- For CX, the instance shall be a server group or local authentication.
- For AP, the instance shall be a server group.

seq-id.description: The sequence id determines the authentication method order.

mgmt-server-group.description: Management server group. null in case of auth-method LOCAL

x-enumDescriptions.LOCAL: Indicate the type of management users with local privilege.

default-role.description: Predefined management role to assign to authenticated administrative users.

load-balance.description: After this function is enabled, load balancing can be implemented between the two aaa management servers.

failthrough.description:
Enable authentication fail-through. This determines whether to access the next Authentication server in case of an authentication failure from the current one.
If true, the next server in line will be accessed.
If false, the authentication process will be aborted at the
first instance of an authentication failure.

x-enumDescriptions.ALL_FAIL: Enable the mode to use local authentication after authentication server authentication failure
x-enumDescriptions.TIMEOUT_FAIL: Enable the use of local authentication mode if authentication server times out

fail-to-local.x-typeDescription: Local authentication after authentication server authentication failure
fail-to-local.description: Local authentication after authentication server authentication failure

disable-username.description: Bypass username for authentication to get manager or operator mode access.

authorization-group.description: Specifies the list of server groups and the order in which they will be applied for authorization of management sessions.

authz-instances.description:
Server group configuration.
- For CX, the instance shall be a server group or local authorization.

seq-id.description: The sequence id determines the authorization method order.

x-enumDescriptions.AUTO: Auto authorization, uses authentication method for authorization.

mgmt-server-group.description: Management server group. null in case of authorization-method of LOCAL or NONE

radius.description: Specifies the list of Radius server groups and the order in which they will be applied for authorization of secure mangement sessions(SSH and REST only).

x-enumDescriptions.HTTPS_SERVER: https-server Session consists of both web and rest

failthrough.description:
Enable authorization fail-through. This determines whether to access the next remote AAA server in case of failure with the current server, the authorization will be attempted with the next configured server.
If true, the next server in line will be accessed.
If false, authorization will not be attempted with the next server.

accounting-group.description: Specifies the list of server groups and the order in which they will be applied for accounting of management sessions.

x-enumDescriptions.HTTPS_SERVER: https-server Session consists of both web and rest
x-enumDescriptions.SYSTEM: accounting for system reset, reboot and accounting on/off

x-enumDescriptions.START_STOP: Send start and stop accounting record

acct-instances.description:
Server group configuration.
- For CX, the instance shall be a server group or local accounting.

seq-id.description: The sequence id determines the accounting method order.

mgmt-server-group.description: Management server group.null in case of accounting-method LOCAL

failthrough.description:
Enable accounting fail-through. This determines whether to access the next remote AAA server in case accounting is not recorded with the current server, the accounting will be attempted with the next configured server.
If true, the next server in line will be accessed.
If false, accounting will not be attempted with the next server.

x-enumDescriptions.UNIQUE: Use a Unique Session ID for each accounting services.
x-enumDescriptions.COMMON: Use a common ID for all accounting services.

acct-session.description: Configure how the accounting sessions are identified.

acct-switch-id.description: Include Switch identity when generating the session-id.

supress-null-username.description: Supress accouting for users with no username

webservers.description: Configurations related to authentication, access level and user session management for webservers hosted in the device

enable.description: Enable web user interface access to the system. On PVOS, default value is true and for GWs default value is false

absolute-session-timeout.description: User's absolute WebUI session timeout <30-3600> (seconds). A value of 0 means no timeout

bypass-cp-landing-page.description: Enable bypass captive portal landing page

captive-portal-cert.description: Configure Server Certificate for Captive Portal

items.description: Enable cipher suites. GCM encryption based cipher suites are default

exclude-http-security-headers.description: Exclude security headers from HTTP response

x-enumDescriptions.CERTIFICATE: Use Client Certificate Authentication to Configure Management User's WebUI Access
x-enumDescriptions.USERNAME_PASSWORD: Use Username/Password Authentication to Configure Management User's WebUI Access

items.x-typeDescription: Authentication options for accessing the system webserver
items.description: Authentication modes enabled for users to request access to the webserver resources

x-enumDescriptions.RADIUS: Use Radius server as authorization source for the client role

certificate-authorization.x-typeDescription: Authorization source options for client role assignment when using certificate-based authentication
certificate-authorization.description:
Authorization source for client-role assignment.
Only valid when 'mgm-auth' value is set to 'CERTIFICATE'.
This configuration is AOSCX specific

x-enumDescriptions.COMMON_NAME: Read the username from the CN field of the certificate
x-enumDescriptions.USER_PRINCIPAL_NAME: Read the username from the UPN field of the certificate

certificate-auth-username.x-typeDescription: Certificate field options to search username when using certificate-based authentication
certificate-auth-username.description:
Certificate field used to read the username when authenticating an user.
Only valid when 'mgm-auth' value is set to 'CERTIFICATE'.
This configuration is AOSCX specific

session-timeout.description: Configure Webserver user's session timeout for inactivity

items.description: Configure SSL/TLS protocol. Default is TLSv1.2

switch-cert.description: Configure Server Certificate for Management WebUI

via-client-cert-port.description:
Configure Port number used for VIA client-cert based profile download.
Valid range is <1025-65535>. Default value is 8085

https-port-443.description: Enable WebUI access on HTTPS port (443)

max-clients.description: Configure Web servers' maximum supported concurrent clients <25-320>

max-sessions-per-client.description:
Web servers' maximum supported concurrent sessions per client.
Range: 1-8. This configuration is AOSCX specific

x-enumDescriptions.TRADITIONAL: Use the legacy web management interface
x-enumDescriptions.IMPROVED: Use the next-generation web management interface

management-style.x-typeDescription: Web management user interface style options
management-style.description: Web management user interface style. Default is IMPROVED

x-enumDescriptions.OOBM: Enable web management on the Out-of-band Management(OOBM) port only
x-enumDescriptions.DATA: Enable web management on the data ports only
x-enumDescriptions.BOTH: Enable web management on the data ports and OOBM port

listen-port.x-typeDescription: The port types used for web management
listen-port.description: Port type(s) used for web management. Default is BOTH

ssl-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.

management-url.description: URL for the web interface help page

support-url.description: URL for the web interface support page

idle-timeout.description: Web management session timeout in seconds

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
items.description:
VRFs where the webserver is enabled to be accessed.
This configuration is AOSCX specific

x-enumDescriptions.READ_ONLY: Enable read operations only on the webserver
x-enumDescriptions.READ_WRITE: Enable both read and write operation on the webserver

access-mode.x-typeDescription: Data access options allowed for all clients of the webserver
access-mode.description:
Web servers' REST API data management configuration. This configuration applies to all users,
regardless of their authorization role. Range: read-only, read-write.
This configuration is AOSCX specific

ArubaSshServer_SshServerGlobalConfig.description: Grouping for SSH Server global configuration.

x-enumDescriptions.PASSWORD: Require a certificate and a password for two factor authentication.
x-enumDescriptions.RADIUS: Request authorization from a RADIUS server for two factor authentication.

two-factor-authentication.description: Require a certificate and a password for authentication.

certificate-as-authorized-key.description: Check authenticating certificate for login username instead of local authorized-keys.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
items.description: VRFs where SSH server is enabled.

priority.description:
Priority of the SSH cipher.
For CX device: valid range: 1-9.

algorithm.description:
SSH cipher type.
For CX device: rijndael-cbc@lystor.liu.se and 3des-cbc cipher types are not supported.

priority.description:
Priority of the SSH host key algorithm.
For CX device: valid range: 1-7.

x-enumDescriptions.ECDSA_SHA2_NISTP256: SSH host key algorithm type ecdsa-sha2-nistp256.
x-enumDescriptions.ECDSA_SHA2_NISTP384: SSH host key algorithm type ecdsa-sha2-nistp384.
x-enumDescriptions.ECDSA_SHA2_NISTP521: SSH host key algorithm type ecdsa-sha2-nistp521.
x-enumDescriptions.RSA_SHA2_256: SSH host key algorithm type rsa-sha2-256.
x-enumDescriptions.RSA_SHA2_512: SSH host key algorithm type rsa-sha2-512.
x-enumDescriptions.SSH_ED25519: SSH host key algorithm type ssh-ed25519.
x-enumDescriptions.SSH_RSA: SSH host key algorithm type ssh-rsa.
x-enumDescriptions.X509V3_SSH_RSA: SSH host key algorithm type x509v3-ssh-rsa.
x-enumDescriptions.X509V3_SIGN_RSA: SSH host key algorithm type x509v3-sign-rsa.
x-enumDescriptions.X509V3_SIGN_RSA2: SSH host key algorithm type x509v3-sign-rsa2.
x-enumDescriptions.SSH_DSS: SSH host key algorithm type ssh-dss.

algorithm.description:
SSH host key algorithm.
For CX device: x509v3-ssh-rsa,  x509v3-sign-rsa,  x509v3-sign-rsa2, and ssh-dss
host-key algorithm types are not supported.

priority.description: Priority of the SSH key exchange algorithm.

x-enumDescriptions.CURVE25519_SHA256: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type curve25519-sha256.
x-enumDescriptions.CURVE25519_SHA256_LIBSSH_ORG: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type curve25519-sha256@libssh.org.
x-enumDescriptions.DIFFIE_HELLMAN_GROUP_EXCHANGE_SHA1: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1.
x-enumDescriptions.DIFFIE_HELLMAN_GROUP_EXCHANGE_SHA256: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256.
x-enumDescriptions.DIFFIE_HELLMAN_GROUP14_SHA1: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type diffie-hellman-group14-sha1.
x-enumDescriptions.DIFFIE_HELLMAN_GROUP14_SHA256: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type diffie-hellman-group14-sha256.
x-enumDescriptions.DIFFIE_HELLMAN_GROUP16_SHA512: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type diffie-hellman-group16-sha512.
x-enumDescriptions.DIFFIE_HELLMAN_GROUP18_SHA512: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type diffie-hellman-group18-sha512.
x-enumDescriptions.ECDH_SHA2_NISTP256: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type ecdh-sha2-nistp256.
x-enumDescriptions.ECDH_SHA2_NISTP384: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type ecdh-sha2-nistp384.
x-enumDescriptions.ECDH_SHA2_NISTP521: SSH key exchange (kex) algorithm type ecdh-sha2-nistp521.

priority.description:
Priority of the SSH MAC.
For CX device: valid range: 1-7.

algorithm.description:
SSH MAC alogorithm.
For CX device: hmac-md5 and hmac-md5-96 mac algorithms are not supported.

priority.description: Priority of the SSH public key algorithm.

x-enumDescriptions.ECDSA_SHA2_NISTP256: SSH public key algorithm type ecdsa-sha2-nistp256.
x-enumDescriptions.ECDSA_SHA2_NISTP384: SSH public key algorithm type ecdsa-sha2-nistp384.
x-enumDescriptions.ECDSA_SHA2_NISTP521: SSH public key algorithm type ecdsa-sha2-nistp521.
x-enumDescriptions.SSH_ED25519: SSH public key algorithm type ssh-ed25519.
x-enumDescriptions.SSH_RSA: SSH public key algorithm type ssh-rsa.
x-enumDescriptions.RSA_SHA2_256: SSH public key algorithm type rsa-sha2-256.
x-enumDescriptions.RSA_SHA2_512: SSH public key algorithm type rsa-sha2-512.
x-enumDescriptions.X509V3_ECDSA_SHA2_NISTP256: SSH public key algorithm type x509v3-ecdsa-sha2-nistp256.
x-enumDescriptions.X509V3_ECDSA_SHA2_NISTP384: SSH public key algorithm type x509v3-ecdsa-sha2-nistp384.
x-enumDescriptions.X509V3_ECDSA_SHA2_NISTP521: SSH public key algorithm type x509v3-ecdsa-sha2-nistp521.
x-enumDescriptions.X509V3_RSA2048_SHA256: SSH public key algorithm type x509v3-rsa2048-sha256.
x-enumDescriptions.X509V3_SIGN_RSA: SSH public key algorithm type x509v3-sign-rsa.
x-enumDescriptions.X509V3_SSH_RSA: SSH public key algorithm type x509v3-ssh-rsa.

allow-list.description:
SSH host allow list configuration.
For CX device, maximum of 20 entries in allow-list is supported.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
The ipv4-address type represents an IPv4 address in
dotted-quad notation.  The IPv4 address may include a zone
index, separated by a % sign.
The zone index is used to disambiguate identical address
values.  For link-local addresses, the zone index will
typically be the interface index number or the name of an
interface.  If the zone index is not present, the default
zone of the device will be used.
The canonical format for the zone index is the numerical
format

The ipv4-prefix type represents an IPv4 address prefix.
The prefix length is given by the number following the
slash character and must be less than or equal to 32.
A prefix length value of n corresponds to an IP address
mask that has n contiguous 1-bits from the most
significant bit (MSB) and all other bits set to 0.
The canonical format of an IPv4 prefix has all bits of
the IPv4 address set to zero that are not part of the
IPv4 prefix.

items.description: List of ipv4 hosts that are allowed to connect to the server.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
The ipv6-address type represents an IPv6 address in full,
mixed, shortened, and shortened-mixed notation.  The IPv6
address may include a zone index, separated by a % sign.
The zone index is used to disambiguate identical address
values.  For link-local addresses, the zone index will
typically be the interface index number or the name of an
interface.  If the zone index is not present, the default
zone of the device will be used.
The canonical format of IPv6 addresses uses the textual
representation defined in Section 4 of RFC 5952.  The
canonical format for the zone index is the numerical
format as described in Section 11.2 of RFC 4007.

The ipv6-prefix type represents an IPv6 address prefix.
The prefix length is given by the number following the
slash character and must be less than or equal to 128.
A prefix length value of n corresponds to an IP address
mask that has n contiguous 1-bits from the most
significant bit (MSB) and all other bits set to 0.
The IPv6 address should have all bits that do not belong
to the prefix set to zero.
The canonical format of an IPv6 prefix has all bits of
the IPv6 address set to zero that are not part of the
IPv6 prefix.  Furthermore, the IPv6 address is represented
as defined in Section 4 of RFC 5952.

items.description: List of ipv6 hosts that are allowed to connect to the server.

server-port.description: TCP port where the SSH server will listen on.

timeout.description: Number of seconds before the authentication times out.

max-auth-attempts.description: Maximum number of retries during the SSH login.

rekey-time.description: Time in minutes before an SSH rekey is initiated.

rekey-volume.description: Amount of traffic in KB before an SSH rekey is initiated.

x-enumDescriptions.BOTH: SSH listen type both out-of-band Management and Data Plane.

listen-interface.description: The type of interface that the SSH server is available.

file-transfer.description: Enable the SSH file transfer server.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
